Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Flickering Lights] Hey everybody it's closing time. You don't got to go home but you can't stay here. [Plays radio and the song is Closing Time by Semisonic]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Laughs and shrieks]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Closing time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Every office needs an end of the day tradition. Something to tell you the day is over. Otherwise, you go home and the night just feels like more day. It's weird.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Closing time

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [On phone] ...W R K.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: One last call for alcohol so finish your whiskey and beer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh no it's W R K, as in kitten. Oh my boss is singing Closing Time, maybe that's what you are hearing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on pam!

Quote.Speaker: Andy/Pam
Quote.Text: [Singing, Pam mumbling lyrics] Closing time, time for you to go home to the places you will be from.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let's see. Andy has been manager for a hundred and five days. Which means I've heard 'Closing Time' a hundred and five times. [nods and shakes head] Still don't know the words. Tah wa Ta way hm hm home and home and home.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know who I want to take me home. I know who I want to take me home. [Pulls towel through legs] I know who I want to take me home. [Spins Meredith in chair] Take me hooo...hooome! You know what fine! I try to start fun traditions for you guys, but if you don't want to sing... no traditions!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [singing] Closing time every new beginning...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I've never heard that song before. And once I heard it, I did not care for it, but that song means it's time to go home. Now...it's my favorite song.

Quote.Speaker: Andy/Stanley
Quote.Text: [singing] Every new beginning comes from some other beginnings end.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Goodnight.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whose your favorite iron chef?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [speaking at the same time as andy] This is atrocious.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You go first.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: The ticketing software paints a picture of a sloppy, careless, error prone office.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well the monitoring software is a double edged sword. Sometimes...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [runs in and interrupts] Sorry, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [to dwight] Did you need something from us?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wha...Yes. Your attention. Uh because... No that is all. [walks out]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Last night I dreamed that the number two was the most valued number in the world. The vice president had all the power. Athletes fought for silver medals. Women were considered the best gender. And stadiums of fans shouted "We're number two!'. As with all my dreams, I'm guessing it was about my fear of immigrants.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Last week an accounting mistake resulted in a client getting their order for free.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Umpf...that's not good. Chalk that one up to Tweedle Dee and Tweedle Dumb out there.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Who are they?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They're both Kevin. Oscar is the Sex and the City gang and Angela, if you can picture...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andrew sometimes I feel like you don't know me at all.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I would agree with that.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Simply...end the mistakes

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: End the mistakes, easy-

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: When I come back next week and this report shows me no mistakes, we can talk about names, all day. Our favorite names, silly made up names, normal names said in a silly voice. Wouldn't that be nice?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I would like that.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: End the mistakes. That is all I ask. [gets up from chair] And you can't have a favorite Iron Chef. It depends entirely on the secret ingredient. Sometimes I feel you don't know food at all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm just saying with the NBA lockout I think roller derby's in a really good place now. So...my pitch is...me, Pam, you and, someone else maybe Justine.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nahh! [shakes head] No. Not Justine. Never Justine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that off again?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Hey, mandatory warehouse safety meeting. Today.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Ahh...We don't really do those. We just sign the thing.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Are you really this lazy?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll be there.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Monday's suck.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Yeaha...yup. [awkward silence then points to door] Just trying to get in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I may have a little solution to our mistakes problem. This is a project I've been working on for quite some time and today, might be the day to use it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What do you got?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [opens folder] Allow me. You're going to love this. [struggles opening folder] Ugh...should've used a shorter string. Never mind, I know it by heart. It is a system that holds people accountable for everyone else's work.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sounds controversial.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have I not been worthy of your trust? Have I not been a reliable number two?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do not go there! You're the deuce I never want to drop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I can make this work. I'll set it up right now. Just need your go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Go do the voodoo that you do so well.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will do my voodoo.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmhmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey. I need you to get the paperwork rolling on a new workplace relationship.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: For you?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yes. For Gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Who are you seeing? That's gr...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Whom I'm seeing is Val from down in the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm not technically seeing her, but uh I've seen her, with the eyes and uh there was attraction. In at least one direction. So..[holds up fist]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know I don't have to do the paperwork unless you're actually dating.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ok, but once this starts, it's going to be moving fast. It's going to be hot and heavy and I don't want a bunch of bureaucratic red tape wrapped around my jock. You know?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: But I mean...uh have you talked to her? Is sh...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah we had a whole conversation about Mondays...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Do you know her last name, yet?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Toby I'm going to tell you her last name tomorrow because she's going to be screaming it tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: She's going to be screaming her own last name?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey! Watch it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Good luck Gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi guys. I just wanted to say that, you all have been doing amazing work., really.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And I'd like to add that your work has been a little sloppy. So, Dwight and I have implemented a new program that we like to call...Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The accountability booster. It registers every time a mistake has been made in the office. From a late delivery to an accounting error. Five strikes in a day equals a home run. One home run and you're out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If we as a group make five mistakes in a day, something bad happens like we block Minesweeper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or in this case an email gets sent to Robert California containing the consultants report from last year. Remember the one that recommended the branch be shutdown? And as a fail-safe also every negative email you've ever written about him to the group will also be forwarded to him.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What emails are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Robert's favorite songs: Creep by TLC, Creep by Radio Head. You remember that one Jim? There is no way he hasn't strangled at least one stripper. Oscar. He eats his yogurt like he is punishing it for disappointing him. Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That's not that bad actually.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: P.S. We should should kill him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, so you installed a doomsday device?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it's an accountability booster.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which when it goes off it destroys everything. Very similar to a doomsday device.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, you're trying to make me sound like some kind of evil maniac. Now the point is that we are now working in an environment where we have accountability to each other. I am confident that you guys are equal to the task.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um, no we're not and you are a psycho who is ruining our lives.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We can't do this Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Everyone angrily disagreeing]Smile...nod. Smile and nod.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They are making me out to be a Bond villian. I like to think of myself as a brilliant scientist who will stop at nothing to remake the world. Like...not Doctor Moreau someone good. Doctor Frankenstein, Doctor Jekyll, not them. Doctor...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you sure this is a good idea? I mean the thing about this office is, we make a lot of mistakes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But the device will change that. Without a safety net, people will improve.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright everybody, looks like we need to be getting to work. Be extra careful. Double check everything or the accountability booster will getcha.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This doomsdays device sounds like a scare tactic to me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: There's an easy way to tell if this device is a sham. We just make a mistake. I'll send an order down to shipping before we've received payment.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [alert goes off] Oh, there's one mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Now we only have four strikes left until a home run.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight's our co-worker and he worked really hard on this doomsday device so I...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not a doomsday device, gosh. [Erin makes red strike on desk] We can do this you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse Crew
Quote.Text: First. Second.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's not a race.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse Crew
Quote.Text: Thirrrr....third.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Who knows what the belt is for?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: It's for protecting my ass. When you suckers lift more than you can handle. Sup, I'm Gabe. Corporate. Continue. Don't be nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Apparently we have a visitor. Gabe, everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse Crew
Quote.Text: Hi, gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right so the support belt. Now this one is mine. Doesn't get much use nowadays.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Look at this, this is enormous.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I get the sense that Val enjoys a good putdown. Considering that's the only thing I know about her. I will be milking that hard. [Gestures milking a cow]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: It's like a hula hoop. Right. Mele Kalikimaka is the wise way.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You done?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: The Michelin man called, he wants his cummerbund back.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Remember we have to give Rigo Escrow their refund by five.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm on it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin, maybe I should handle that. We really need you to focus on your project.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Good thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Apparently a big client for this company, needs to know the story of how paper gets made.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar, use a calculator. [Oscar shakes head]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: When the stakes are this high, there is only one computer that I trust. And it's powered by thai food and spanish reds. [points to his head]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright everybody, you are doing great!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I wouldn't say that. Three mistakes already is pretty terrible, but I do see improvement. Meredith kept someone on hold for thirty minutes and now look she's hard at work. [Meredith gives dwight the finger]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, question.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No questions.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If this doomsday device goes off...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Accountability booster.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If this bad idea goes off and we all lose our jobs. Are you going to feel good about that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I haven't even considered it. That's how sure I am that this accountability booster is going to work.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Try mose1234.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dwight would never be that obvious. Try something like...z64$8. [incorrect password] Not that exactly Jim, something like that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How about Scrantonstrangler666.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Oh shoot. Ha ha ha...You guys are never gonna shut down the machine, ok? But I appreciate your energy and your team work. If you applied this to your regular work, You won't even notice that the device is there, watching you ready to strike.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Wha...what's Dwight's mothers name.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm...Heda. [alert] No.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Once you read the packet, sign the back.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey Darryl, I was thinking, uh, maybe while we read through this, uh, you could grab us all some coffee. My treat. It's a hundred dollar bill. Should cover it I think. Don't bring me any of that caramel soy latte crap, ok? I want a decaf frappuccino. Val...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Actually, Val, why don't you come with? I'll need the extra hands to carry them back.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Uh.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mmhmm. [points at gabe] Caramel soy latte.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Decaf frap-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You sent the late notice to Ryan Heart & Wolf. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Mhm. Six-forty, six-twenty.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Six-seventy, six-twenty.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Nuh uh.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: yes!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Five eighty-eight plus fifteen percent- Oh no.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What does this mean? What does it mean!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy. [alert sounds]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ohhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gahhh. That's five strikes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [pulls out Brandy bottle] Well...I was saving this for my retirement, which I guess is today.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight we got five strikes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did the email go out or...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It goes out automatically at five P.M.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, th- There's gotta be a way to stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I would have to enter my password in order to cancel it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok! Dwight you may now enter your password.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't deserve to have this branch. Five mistakes in less than a day.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We did our best.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No you didn't, Phyllis. You complained the whole time. You yelled at me. You tried to break into the machine. [everyone interjects] What?!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're a real crumb bum, you know that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, you can't just change the rules because you don't like the outcome. What about you, Kevin? What about you and your fake task? Can you tell me now where paper comes from?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Uh, the man tree puts its penis-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha. Ok, alright. Andy back me up here, please.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nn no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dwight be human for once. Shut down the machine.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Shut it down! Shut it down! Shut down the machine!!! [erin joins in yelling] Shut it down! Shut it down!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good luck finding a new job idiots. I'll make sure to write you a glowing reference. Glowingly negative.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dwight's car is gone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I bet he went home.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Some of us should go there and talk some sense into him. Get him to stop that email.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pam, you should come with me. Dwight really likes you and your breasts are enormous that could help us.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kevin has that lovability.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Guys come on. I'm right here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim, I want you to go find Robert just be where he is in case that email goes out at five. You can try to delete it or something.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, where is he?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh, he's at some club where you either eat squash or play squash.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll try both.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [digging] Oh. Come to reason with me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gotcha something. [gives Dwight cap, Dwight throws it aside] And, uh, I just really want to talk to you-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get lost.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well now hold on it, it-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What does it look like I'm doing? Digging a grave for a horse.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uhm.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do you need a hand?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, do you need a hand? [everyone joins in]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you hit another horse, you've dug to far.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'll see you next week Will. [at the club, playing squash]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Robert.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Jim what are you...What a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, you know just had a meeting. Squash meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You up for a game?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: A game or a match?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Exactly. Here we go. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you okay, Kevin? [Kevin gives thumbs down]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Where you going?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In. I'm hungry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, could we come in too? Just for some water.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Take off your shoes. Except you Kevin, they stay on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, wow. I forgot how pretty your house is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is the new addition, built my Erasmus Schrute in 1808. It doubled as a tuberculosis recovery room until 2009.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: That's too much Doodle and not enough Lab.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, when are they gonna do a Labradoodle that's just Lab?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: That's what I'm sayin'.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [to Val] Hey. You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Thanks for the coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: So, tonight I was thinking, I'm gonna go to the cemetery. I'm gonna drink a little wine and I thought maybe you'd like to come with me.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Are you asking me on a date?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yes, I am.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Because I don't date coworkers. It's not personal, it's a matter of policy.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I could quit. Problem solved.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Don't quit. [Darryl eavesdropping, nods]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Good policy. Sensible. Smart.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. Serving. Serving. Serving. Serving.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: In the box.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In the box. [hits it straight into the floor]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why haven't we heard anything? It's 4:45. There's only 15 minutes left.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, now you can do math? Where were you 2 hours ago 'A Beautiful Mind'-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I made a mistake. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I know how to save the company, everyone. Just write a petition, get everyones' signature, including our clients, march down to Florida, and shove it up your butt! Ha! [laughing and drinking Brandy]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's not that funny.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Kevin comes around corner with a pan, ready to strike Dwight, Pam shakes her head] Oh, Pam. You got something on your shirt.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, haha. Oh well. Pobody's nerfect, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you just have a stroke, Pam? It's "Nobody's perfect." Nice stroke, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. It's a jokey saying. Pobody's nerfect, like I can't even say those words right. Ha.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I hadn't heard that before, that's, that's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight, there's just a small matter of a-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know what would go so great with this cabbage pie? Milk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Any specific animal?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm thinking cow-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't say cow- Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you doing? It's 5 to 5.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just don't talk about the email, okay? He's gonna cancel it on his own, I really think he will.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's insane!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just trust me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Trust you, like I trusted Dwight this morning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I got this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Enngh-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hahhh, thanks for everything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sive drafely. [Pam points back at him, smiling]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Isn't it supposed to be, "Drive safely"?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [a text tone goes off] Is that my phone?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Sounded like mine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nah, I think it's mine. Lemme just check real quick, here. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well, it's mine. You took it out of my bag.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Can I have it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. Right now? Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here you go. [throws it over glass]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Whoa, no, wait, wait, wait, whoa. [tries to catch it with racket, misses, lands on floor]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [censored beep] ha, Jesus.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Awww, sorry. Did it break?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Nah, it's good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You sure?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What kinda iPhone is that?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It's the standard one. The one everyone has.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. I have the one that nobody has. Is there anything interesting?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It depends Jim. Do you find one-day only Jet Blue sales to Buffalo interesting?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ha ha. No, I don't. No, I don't. Alright, well, I am sore and obviously horrible at this, so- [texting on his phone]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: My serve!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [her text tones rings] Dwight stopped the device!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Haho!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [his phone vibrates] He stopped it!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh! [everyone yelling out, celebrating] We still have our jobs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They're not my favorite people in the world. I wouldn't even call them friends. They come over here, eat my pie, dig the crappiest horse grave you've ever seen. [pulls cap he previously discarded, out of the dirt] God, I'm gonna have to work with them forever, aren't I?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Take it easy. Nice and easy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hits ball, ricochets to groin] Ah! Classic, right? [Jim continues to rally poorly and falls down]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oo!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm alright.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You alright?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Skinned knee.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. Ah. Oh. [and skinned elbow]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oo, a little ice on that maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. That does not feel good.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Okay. My serve.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's not make any mistakes today. Or at least no more than four.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This doomsday device sounds like a scare tactic to me. Y2K all over again.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, I was all about the Y2K bug. Paid some guy to update my PC, threw out my microwave, canceled my plane ticket, sold all my stocks, spent New Year's Eve with a gas mask on my face. I was even wearing a diaper! Someone said Y2K would get the toilets.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This could be real. Dwight's pretty handy with computers. He fixed my laptop once.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, he didn't fix it. The brightness level was all the way down.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You couldn't fix it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I wasn't here that day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes you were.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No- Ok. Well, we'll talk about it later. Straussburg! I had a meeting in Straussburg and I dropped you off beforehand. I was wearing a tan shirt with stripes?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think so, babe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, this is crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have never played squash. But I have seen it in countless 80's movies and it seems like the most common mistake is that you serve too hard and hit yourself right in the squash balls. So, as long as I don't do that, I think I'll be alright.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Eleven love. I win again.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [grunts] Good game. You are a worthy opponent. You wanna play one more?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No? Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Why? Not only are you terrible at squash, but you don't even seem to enjoy it. Jim, this is not enough of a challenge for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, that is... because you didn't realize that... I was left-handed.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What are you doing here, Gabe?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well Darryl, considering that I basically own the place, I'm just chillin' at mi casa. This is me, in repose..I suppose.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You know, there's this expression: Bro's before Ho's. And what that's short for is brothers before whores. Uh, I don't buy that. I would throw any brother under the bus for any whore. Woman.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Robert, do you wanna smoke pipes during our meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Let's wait, until we have something to smoke about.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes. Of course. [whispers] Erin..[throws pipes at Erin]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe I could sit in on this one with you? You know, that way I can cover you in case you need to urinate or you just want another opinion, or defecate...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well I just thought with my new increased responsibilities and all...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. I'm still figuring out the two man bobsled here, so let's hold off on the D-man for now.
